articles.author: Saurabh Sharma, Tariq Maqbool, Aftab Ahmed
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire was holding between India and Pakistan on Sunday, after hours of overnight fighting between the nuclear-armed neighbours, as U.S. President Donald Trump said he will work to provide a solution regarding Kashmir.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holds between India, Pakistan as Trump offers more help

articles.author: Marina Bobrova, Dmitry Antonov, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday proposed direct talks with Ukraine on May 15 in Istanbul that he said should be aimed at achieving a durable peace and eliminating the root causes of the war.
articles.title: Putin proposes direct peace talks with Ukraine after three years of war

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Humeyra Pamuk, Alexander Cornwell
articles.description: When U.S. President Donald Trump lands in Riyadh on Tuesday, he will be greeted with opulent ceremonies, gilded palaces and the prospect of $1 trillion in investments. But, the raging war in Gaza has denied him one goal he has long craved: Saudi-Israel normalisation.
articles.title: Prospects of Saudi ties to Israel elusive as Trump seeks $1 trillion bonanza

articles.author: Emma Farge, John Revill
articles.description: Senior U.S. and Chinese officials met again on Sunday in Geneva, two sources familiar with the situation told Reuters, to resume weekend talks aimed at cooling the trade war that threatens to seriously damage the global economy.
articles.title: US-China talks to defuse trade row resume in Geneva

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Top Iranian and U.S. negotiators will resume talks on Sunday to address disputes over Tehran's nuclear programme, in a push for progress as Washington hardens its stance ahead of U.S. President Donald Trump's Middle East visit.
articles.title: Iran, US to resume nuclear talks amid clashing red lines

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Leo said the world was living through "the dramatic scenario of a Third World War being fought piecemeal," repeating a phrase coined by Pope Francis.
articles.title: Pope Leo XIV appeals for 'no more war' in first Sunday message

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey is ready to host peace talks between Russia and Ukraine in Istanbul again, President Tayyip Erdogan told his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in a phone call on Sunday, Erdogan's office said.
articles.title: Turkey ready to host Russia-Ukraine peace talks, Erdogan tells Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on Russia on Sunday to confirm an unconditional ceasefire beginning on May 12, saying Ukraine would then be ready to meet for direct talks with Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy calls on Russia to confirm ceasefire before talks

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci, Edward Mcallister
articles.description: Albania holds parliamentary elections on Sunday in which prime minister Edi Rama is seeking an unprecedented fourth term in office after a campaign dominated by promises to join the European Union and accusations of widespread graft.
articles.title: Albania votes as PM Rama seeks fourth term

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Under the draft, Ukraine would agree to permanent neutrality in return for international security guarantees from the five permanent members of the U.N. Security Council.
articles.title: Kremlin focuses on draft 2022 deal for proposed peace talks
